content: For the moment, HIR items (Item, TraitItem, ImplItem) are stored by association kind (resp. none, trait, impl). Another choice is possible: storing by item kind (fn, static, const, types...). What is the rationale for one choice wrt. the other?
cc @nikomatsakis and @eddyb, related to #40697
I would prefer to have fewer kinds, it makes it easier to keep track of the ParamEnv
Especially for rustdoc there aren't many tests in this area and I'd like the relevant code be correct on inspection if at all possible
